timeline.message:
[DOC] Clarify kafka Connect configuration

Signed-off-by: prmellor <pmellor@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText: using "currently" let me think that it could be in the future. I would remove it, I don't think we are going to support it.
timeline.author: ppatierno
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -8,6 +8,9 @@
 
 link:https://kafka.apache.org/documentation/#connect[Kafka Connect^] is a tool for streaming data between Apache Kafka and external systems.
 
+In Strimzi, Kafka Connect is deployed in distributed mode.
+Kafka Connect can also work in standalone mode, but this is currently not supported by Strimzi.

replies.bodyText: I guess I wrote it like this. I think we have it somewhere at the bottom of our backlog. There are lot of requirements for Connect to work with PVs etc. and standalone as a singleton might be easier that way. That said, I do not plan any work on that anytime soon. So I can live without the currently as well.
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.bodyText: Quick search suggests that this is used in a lot more files than just this one ... are you sure it can be safely removed?
timeline.author: scholzj

replies.bodyText: It was a duplicate. There's also one on line 123.
